intro: Franseria flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible franseria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It features slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Franseria flexuosa is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and resilience in coastal environments.
